page.title: 07NEWLAND PARK, 1.
page.content: At first some children thought that {Newland Park}was a recreational play area. When we arrived we discovered that it was a long windy road full of different types of houses. It is a quiet road which comes off one of the busiest routes into Hull. In Newland Park there are about two hundred houses. They are all large houses. Some are detached houses, some are semi-detached, some are bungalows and there was a small block of six flats. There are no terraced houses. The trees in the gardens sread across the road like an archway. All the gardens are enormous. In the gardens you can see large areas of grass surrounded by deep borders full of brightly coloured flowers and shrubs. In some of the gardens there are some unusual things, such as a full size anchor.
